name: Paneer Butter Masala
history: Paneer Butter Masala, also known as Butter Paneer, is a rich and creamy dish from North Indian cuisine. It's a popular dish in Indian restaurants and is known for its smooth, buttery gravy.
description: Paneer Butter Masala is a decadent dish made with soft paneer cubes simmered in a creamy tomato-based sauce. It's seasoned with butter, cream, and a blend of aromatic spices, offering a delightful culinary experience.

instructions.title: Prepare the Gravy Base
instructions.description: Heat butter in a pan. Add cumin seeds, onions, and ginger-garlic paste. SautÃ© until onions are golden. Add tomato puree, red chili powder, turmeric powder, and salt. Cook until oil separates.

instructions.title: Add Spices and Cream
instructions.description: Add garam masala and kasuri methi to the gravy. Stir in the cream and cook for a few minutes.

instructions.title: Cook the Paneer
instructions.description: Add paneer cubes to the gravy. Add water to adjust consistency. Cook for 5-7 minutes.

instructions.title: Finish with Sugar
instructions.description: Stir in sugar and simmer for another 2 minutes.

instructions.title: Garnish and Serve
instructions.description: Garnish with chopped cilantro. Serve hot with naan, roti, or rice.

tips: Use fresh, homemade paneer for the best taste and texture.
Be careful not to overcook the paneer as it can become tough.
variations: Add vegetables like peas or bell peppers for extra nutrition.
For a vegan version, substitute paneer with tofu and cream with coconut milk.

storage.shelfLife: Can be refrigerated for up to 2 days.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat on the stove or in a microwave until hot.
presentationTips: Serve in a decorative bowl with a dollop of cream on top.
Pair with a cooling cucumber raita or salad.
